pullRequest.title: GH-2143 ensure project is binary compatible with 3.1 releases
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #2143  
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

modified several RDF* related changes to ensure reasonable defaults are in place
modified several recent public and protected method changes to ensure binary compatibility
configured japicmp to check (and fail!) build on both source and binary compatibility with previous minor release. It ignore items annotated with InternalUseOnly or Experimental.


PR Author Checklist:

 my pull request is self-contained
 I've added tests for the changes I made
 every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
 every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

commit.message: GH-2143 added old method signatures for binary compatility

GH-2143 fixed (binary) backward compatibity issues

- using temporary default methods as a stop-gap measure to ensure
  existing code will continue to run and compile
- using `@implNote` and `@apiNote` javadoc tags to document expectations
GH-2143 configure japicmp plugin to check binary/source compatibility

nodes.bodyText: This is one of the many reasons why I want stop using protected as a modifier, as much as possible. I realize we've previously said that we don't really consider protected methods part of the public API, but the fact of the matter is that they're there, and accessible to subclass implementors, and in some cases we even expect subclass implementors to override our protected methods.
